brief_summary.textblock:
To observe the effect of early goal directed therapy (EGDT) on hepatic perfusion in patients
      with septic shock.

      Hypothesis: Hepatic perfusion did not improved after EGDT in patients with septic shock.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of EGDT on Hepatic Perfusion in Patients With Septic Shock

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective To observe the effect of early goal directed therapy (EGDT) on hepatic perfusion
      in patients with septic shock.

      Methods A prospective observational study was carried out. The eligible patients were
      treated with the standard procedure of EGDT. The hemodynamic data were recorded. Oxygen
      metabolism and hepatic function were monitored. Indocyanine clearance test was applied to
      detect the hepatic perfusion. Hemodynamics, hepatic perfusion, oxygen metabolism and hepatic
      function were compared before treatment, after EGDT and 24 hours after EGDT.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with septic shock

          2. at least one of the EGDT criteria not achieved

          3. informed consent accepted

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. ages below 18 or above 90

          2. pregnancy

          3. the time elapsed over 24 hours after onset of septic shock

          4. chronic liver disease

          5. terminal stage of disease

          6. brain death

          7. other types of shock

          8. brain injury

          9. allergic to iodine or indocyanine

study_pop.textblock: Critical patients with early septic shock admitted to ICU within 24 hours after onset
